alert.note: Alert for Central Willamette Valley; Greater Portland Metro Area (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 1:22PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...A strong storm will impact portions of west central Clackamas, east central Yamhill, northwestern Marion and southeastern Washington Counties through 145 PM PDT... At 118 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong storm over Tualatin, or 10 miles west of Oregon City, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Deadly lightning will be possible with this storm. Enough small hail and rain will fall to result in a brief period of hazardous travel conditions, particularly along Interstate 5 near Wilsonville or more broadly speaking between Aurora and I-205. Locations impacted include... Oregon City, Tigard, Lake Oswego, Tualatin, West Linn, Wilsonville, Canby, Aurora, Rivergrove, Butteville, Sherwood, King City, Durham and Barlow. This includes the following highways in Oregon... Interstate 5 between mile markers 279 and 290. Interstate 205 between mile markers 1 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Willamette Valley; Greater Portland Metro Area
